body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:

When i upgrade my kubernetes cluster windows node  to 1.15,the windows node kube-proxy cannot work properly.  My  windows deployment cannt access by Nodeip:Port on this node but it can access by  the same cluster other nodes with  Nodeip:Port 

When i rollback my windows node  to 1.14.1 .  the kube-proxy works good, everything is ok

The kube-proxy logs  Loop Report that.

```
E0628 16:57:08.673912    1180 hnsV2.go:36] Network Id  not found
E0628 16:57:08.673912    1180 proxier.go:564] Unable to find HNS Network specified by cbr0. Please check network name and CNI deployment
E0628 16:57:09.679372    1180 hnsV2.go:36] Network Id  not found
E0628 16:57:09.679372    1180 proxier.go:564] Unable to find HNS Network specified by cbr0. Please check network name and CNI deployment
```

* 1.15.0

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7907809/60331135-8e362c00-99c6-11e9-9853-faaf9d781cb4.png)

At this version , i cannot access my application by current node ip and the port

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7907809/60331564-832fcb80-99c7-11e9-948e-b574425d4d54.png)


---------

* 1.14.1
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7907809/60331148-93937680-99c6-11e9-9ab7-c69adf56f243.png)

At this version , i can access my application by current node ip and the port

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7907809/60331536-7317ec00-99c7-11e9-81c7-76d55f405777.png)


**What you expected to happen**:

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):1.15.0
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`): windows server 2019 (10.0.17763.134)
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug): flannel host-gw
- Others:
@feiskyer @andyzhangx

title: The kubernetes 1.15 kube-proxy report  "Unable to find HNS Network specified by cbr0"  on windows  node
